attributes.action: Judicial review of the EU Referendum given the misleading 'Leave' campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
1 The UK Parliament has had the power at any time to vote to leave the EU; it did not need a referendum.
2 NATO rules can require us to go to war, regardless of Parliament.
3 Asylum is granted under international conventions.
4 Climate change, biodiversity, population growth and armed conflict are problems that can only be tacked at a super-national level.
5 UK alone will have less influence on internet giants and other multi-nationals than the EU has.
Taking back control is illusion and fraud.
attributes.background:
'Leave' called 'Take Back Control' which had a very major impact on the Referendum vote.
The slogan is misleading and dishonest.
International agreements constrain us; multinationals ignore borders.
Any nation state has less power in a globalised world than an alliance like the EU has.

rejection.details:
Judicial review is a type of court proceeding in which a judge reviews the lawfulness of a decision or action made by a public body.

The Leave and Remain campaigns are not public bodies. It is therefore not clear how their actions could be subject to judicial review.
